      • getExecutionGroup

        public GroupIdentifier getExecutionGroup()
        Description copied from interface: ActionDefinition
        Some category of actions may be applied to groups of objects. To make system know what actions to group the definition has an execution group. If action can't be grouped, execution group should be null.
        Specified by:
        getExecutionGroup in interface ActionDefinition

      • registerCommands

        protected void registerCommands()
        Override this method to call registerCommand() only inside body of this method. This guarantees necessary synchronization to be performed

      • registerCommand

        protected void registerCommand(ActionCommand cmd)
        Action may register several parameters (or states) designated by the RequestIdentifier The action passes through these states sequentially with no repeat. If the action repeats it's request a caller may suppose that the action want to reenter invalid data and in automatic mode just stop execution Note this if the action should be able to run in both interactive and silent mode. Interactive mode will re-request the user to enter a parameter but silent won't. So the same RequestIdentifier should describe semantically different steps of an action. The preferred way to distinguish the action request id from other types of action is to add action group id followed by a '.' (dot) symbol with the step name, ie. getGroupId() + ".inputParams" Call this method only inside of the body registerParameters() to perform synchronization!

      • unregisterCommand

        protected void unregisterCommand(java.lang.String id)
